prompt_message.content: Using the numbers 4, 7, and 12, create an equation that equals 100.
Find three consecutive numbers that add up to 72.
If you multiply three different prime numbers to get 231, what are they?
Using the digits 1-9 exactly once, create two numbers that multiply to give the smallest possible result.
What's the smallest number that when divided by 3, 4, and 5 always leaves a remainder of 2?
Using only the number 4 four times and any mathematical operations, create an expression equal to 17.
Find three different positive numbers whose sum and product are the same.
What's the largest three-digit number that's divisible by both 7 and 8?
Using the numbers 2, 3, 5, and 7, create an expression that equals 100.
What's the smallest positive number that becomes a perfect square when increased by 14 or decreased by 14?
What's the smallest number that's both a perfect square and a perfect cube?
Using the digits 2, 4, 6, and 8 exactly once, create a fraction closest to 1.
Find four different numbers whose sum and product are both 20.
What's the largest number you can make using three 3s and any mathematical operations?
Find three prime numbers that add up to 100.
What's the smallest number that when divided by 2,3,4,5,6 always leaves remainder 1?
Create an equation using 1,2,3,4 exactly once that equals 24.
What's the largest two-digit number whose square root is a whole number?
Find three consecutive even numbers that multiply to give 48.
Using five 5s and any operations, create an expression equal to 120.
What's the smallest number that has exactly 10 factors?
Create two different fractions that add up to exactly 1 using digits 1-9 once.
Find four consecutive numbers whose product is 3024.
What's the largest three-digit palindrome divisible by 11?
Using the numbers 1,4,7,8 once each, make 24.
Find three different square numbers that add up to 100.
What's the smallest number that's both triangular and square?
Create an equation using 5,6,7,8 exactly once that equals 50.
Find two prime numbers that add up to 100.
What's the largest number under 1000 that's both a perfect square and a perfect cube?
If you fold a square piece of paper in half twice and then cut a triangle in one corner, what pattern will you see when you unfold it?
If you look at a cube from the front, top, and right side, how many faces of the cube can you see in total?
If you have a red cube inside a larger transparent cube, and rotate the larger cube 90 degrees forward and then 90 degrees right, where is the red cube now?
What shape would you get if you slice a cone with a plane parallel to its side?
If you stack 27 small cubes to make a larger 3x3x3 cube and remove all corner cubes, how many small cubes remain?
If you fold a rectangular paper in half lengthwise, then in half widthwise, then cut off one corner, how many holes will appear when you unfold it?
What shape would you see if you looked directly down on a pyramid from above?
If you connect the midpoints of all sides of any quadrilateral, what shape do you always get?
If you have a cylindrical can and cut it from top to bottom, then flatten it out, what shape do you get?
If you fold a paper into a triangle, then fold it in half three times, what fraction of the original triangle's area is showing?
If you slice a cube with a plane through three corners, what shape do you get?
What shape is formed when two cylinders of equal diameter intersect at right angles?
If you fold a square paper diagonally twice and cut off the tip, what shape appears when unfolded?
How many different rectangles can you see in a 3x4 grid of squares?
If you stack cubes in a pyramid with 4 cubes on each side at the base, how many cubes total?
What's the minimum number of straight cuts needed to divide a cube into 27 smaller cubes?
If you connect the centers of all faces of a cube, what 3D shape do you get?
What shape is formed by the intersection of a sphere and a plane?
If you rotate a right triangle 360° around one of its legs, what 3D shape is formed?
How many different triangles can you make by connecting any three corners of a cube?
What shape do you get when you slice a tetrahedron parallel to one of its faces?
If you fold a circular paper in half three times and unfold, how many creases are there?
What's the maximum number of pieces you can get by cutting a circle with four straight lines?
If you look at a regular octahedron from directly above a vertex, what shape do you see?
How many faces does a shape have if every vertex connects to exactly three edges?
What shape is formed when a cone intersects with a plane parallel to its axis?
If you connect the midpoints of adjacent edges of a cube, what shape do you get?
What's the shape of the shadow cast by a cylinder when light hits it at a 45° angle?
If you slice a donut (torus) through its center, what shape do you get?
How many different squares can you see in a 3x3 grid?

A woman shoots her husband, then holds him underwater for 5 minutes, finally hanging him. Yet the man later goes to work happy and healthy. How is this possible?
A man pushes his car until he reaches a hotel and realizes he's bankrupt. What's going on?
The more you take away, the larger it becomes. What is it?

A man lives on the 10th floor. Every morning he takes the elevator down to the ground floor. However, when returning home, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and walks up the stairs to the 10th floor. Why?
Two mothers and two daughters went shopping. They bought three items in total, and each got exactly one item. How is this possible?
A man walks into a restaurant, orders albatross soup, takes one taste, and kills himself. Why?
What can run but never walks, has a mouth but never talks, has a head but never weeps, has a bed but never sleeps?
A father and son get in a car crash. The father dies, and the son is rushed to the hospital. The surgeon says 'I can't operate on him, he's my son.' How is this possible?
What has keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but not go in?
A man is found dead in a circular mansion. Each resident claims they were in their room at the time of murder. Why doesn't the detective believe them?
A woman has two sons who were born on the same day of the same year, but they're not twins. How is this possible?
What can you hold in your right hand, but never in your left hand?
A man stands on one side of a river, his dog on the other. The man calls his dog, who crosses the river without getting wet. How?
What word in the English language is always spelled incorrectly?
A girl who was just learning to drive went down a one-way street in the wrong direction, but didn't break the law. How?
What has cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and rivers, but no water?
A man rode into town on Friday, stayed three days, and rode out on Friday. How?
What gets wetter and wetter the more it dries?
How can you throw a ball as hard as you can and have it come back to you, even if it doesn't bounce off anything?
What has keys that open no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but not go in?
What breaks when you say it?

A man is trapped in a room with only two exits. One exit leads to a room made of magnifying glass that will fry him instantly. The other exit leads to a room with a fire-breathing dragon. How does he escape?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
A man pushes his car to a hotel and tells the owner he's bankrupt. What's happening?
What has legs but doesn't walk?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has many keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but not go in?
What gets bigger when you take away from it?
If pushing domino A makes domino B fall, and domino B makes domino C fall, but domino C is already down, what happens when you push domino A?
If all roses in a garden die when they don't get water for a week, and it hasn't rained for two weeks, but the roses are alive, what can you conclude?
If every time it rains, the streets get wet, and the streets are wet now, can you conclude that it rained?
If all students who study hard pass the exam, and Jane passed the exam, can you conclude she studied hard?
If turning the key starts the car, and the key is turned but the car doesn't start, what can you deduce?
If eating ice cream always makes Tom happy, and Tom is happy now, must he have eaten ice cream?
If a plant grows taller when given fertilizer, and this plant is taller than last week, can you conclude it was given fertilizer?
If mixing blue and yellow always makes green, and you have green paint, must it have been made by mixing blue and yellow?
If all birds can fly, and you see a flying animal, must it be a bird?
If whenever it snows, schools close, and schools are closed today, can you conclude it snowed?
If a plant grows better in sunlight, and this plant isn't growing well despite being in sunlight, what can you conclude?
If all cats like fish, and Whiskers doesn't like fish, what can you deduce?
If exercise increases heart rate, and your heart rate is elevated, can you conclude you've exercised?
If all metals conduct electricity, and this material conducts electricity, must it be a metal?
If reading improves vocabulary, and Sam has an excellent vocabulary, must he be an avid reader?
If coffee keeps people awake, and Alex is awake at midnight, must they have had coffee?
If studying guarantees passing, and John failed, what can you conclude?
If wind makes leaves rustle, and leaves are rustling now, must it be windy?
If all dolphins are mammals, and this animal is a mammal, must it be a dolphin?
If sugar makes tea sweet, and this tea is sweet, must it contain sugar?
If all experts have degrees, and Sarah has a degree, must she be an expert?
If running makes you sweat, and you're sweating, must you have been running?
If all squares are rectangles, and this shape is a rectangle, must it be a square?
If fever indicates infection, and you have an infection, must you have a fever?
If watering plants makes them grow, and these plants are growing, must someone be watering them?
If all birds lay eggs, and this animal lays eggs, must it be a bird?
If practice makes perfect, and Mary is perfect at piano, must she have practiced a lot?
If all A's are B's, and this is not a B, what can you conclude about it being an A?
If sunlight makes shadows, and there's a shadow here, must the sun be shining?
If all geniuses are creative, and Bob is creative, must he be a genius?
In a drawer there are 10 red socks, 10 blue socks, and 10 black socks. If you reach in the dark and grab socks one at a time, how many socks minimum do you need to grab to guarantee a matching pair?
If you roll two dice, what's the probability of getting a sum greater than 7?
In a bag of 100 marbles, 70 are blue and 30 are red. If you draw 2 marbles without replacement, what's the probability they're different colors?
If you flip a coin 3 times, what's the probability of getting at least one heads?
In a standard deck of 52 cards, what's the probability of drawing two aces in a row without replacement?
If you have 3 red balls and 2 blue balls in a bag and draw 2 balls without replacement, what's the probability of getting matching colors?
What's the probability of getting exactly two 6s when rolling three dice?
If you randomly select 2 numbers from 1-10, what's the probability their sum is even?
In a room of 30 people, what's the probability that at least two people share the same birthday?
If you shuffle a deck of cards and deal 5 cards, what's the probability of getting a flush (all same suit)?
If you have 5 different keys and only one opens the door, what's the probability of opening it on the first try?
In a class of 20 students, what's the probability that none share a birthday month?
If you roll three dice, what's the probability of getting three different numbers?
With 4 red balls and 3 green balls, what's the probability of drawing 2 red balls with replacement?
What's the probability of drawing a royal flush in poker?
If you flip a coin until you get heads, what's the probability it takes exactly 3 flips?
In a bag with 3 black, 4 white, and 5 red marbles, what's the probability of drawing black then white?
What's the probability of rolling a sum of 7 with two dice?
If you randomly arrange the letters in 'MATH', what's the probability of spelling 'MATH'?
In a deck of cards, what's the probability of drawing three hearts in a row with replacement?
What's the probability of getting exactly one 6 when rolling five dice?
If you pick 2 numbers from 1-20, what's the probability their difference is 5?
What's the probability of drawing all face cards when dealing 3 cards?
If you flip 4 coins, what's the probability of getting exactly 2 heads?
In a group of 5 people, what's the probability at least 2 were born in the same month?
What's the probability of drawing 2 kings and 1 queen from a deck in that order?
If you roll two dice, what's the probability their product is even?
What's the probability of getting no pairs when dealt 5 cards?
If you pick 3 random letters, what's the probability of being able to spell 'CAT'?
What's the probability of rolling four dice and getting all different numbers?

How can you cut a cake into 8 equal pieces using only 3 straight cuts?
How can you measure exactly 4 liters using only a 3-liter and a 5-liter container?
How can you cross a river with a wolf, a goat, and a cabbage if you can only take one at a time and can't leave the wolf alone with the goat or the goat alone with the cabbage?
Without using a scale, how can you find the one heavier ball among eight identical-looking balls using just two weighings on a balance scale?

How can you measure 45 seconds using two ropes that each take 1 minute to burn completely (and burn non-uniformly)?
